settings.name: Spatial Resolution for the Utilisation/Occurance Distribution Raster
settings.description: Insert a numeric value to define the grid size of the raster in which the Utilisation/Occurance Distribution shall be estimated by the model. Unit is metre (m). Default is  10000 m = 10 km, which might be too large for smaller scale studies. Note that computation duration increases much with smaller grid sizes and can lead to the necessity of extending your area (see Map extent variable below).

settings.name: Estimated location error
settings.description: Insert a numeric value to specify the locaiton error that your data might have. The unit is metre (m). Defaults to 30 m.

settings.name: Contour percentages
settings.description: Insert the contour percentages that you want calculated and mapped, i.e. the probability that a random animal of the tracked species is found in the estimated area(s) during the considered time period. Possible values above 0 and below 1. If you want more than one contour, enter them in descending order and seperate by comma. Emtpy central areas can be avoided by adding a zero at the end. Example: 0.999,0.9,0.75,0.5,0. Defaults to 0.999.

settings.name: Map extent
settings.description: Insert a numeric value to specify by which additive value (distance in metre) the map extent around your tracks shall be extended for calculating the Utilisation/Occurance Distribution. If you encounter an error that the area is too small, please increase this value. The number should be above the extent of the data set, which is provided in the App's Logs after running, please have a look. Unit = metre. Defaults to 20000 m = 20 km.
